H0.text: The skeletal system provides the same function in vertebrates as xylem cells do in trees, supporting the trunk and branches with thick‑walled structures.

H1.text: The endocrine system provides the same function as xylem cells in a tree, which have very thick walls and make up most of a tree trunk and its branches.

H2.text: The respiratory system is the vertebrate system that performs the same function as xylem cells in a tree, which are thick‑walled cells that make up most of the trunk and branches and transport water.

H3.text: The integumentary system provides the same function in vertebrates as xylem cells do in a tree, which have very thick walls and make up most of the tree trunk and its branches.

A4.text: Bones are rigid organs providing structural support for the body, assistance in movement by opposing muscle contraction, and the forming of a protective wall around internal organs.

A5.text: The skeletons of turtles have evolved to develop a shell from the ribcage, forming an exoskeleton.
